metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the macos-def:nvram_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the macos-def:nvram_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the nvram_object is supported with the nvram_var entity equal to some value.
Test that the nvram_object is supported with the nvram_var entity not equal to some value.
Test that the nvram_object is supported with the nvram_var entity matching some regular expression.

nvram_test.comment: Test that the nvram_object is supported with the nvram_var entity equal to some value.
Test that the nvram_object is supported with the nvram_var entity not equal to some value.
Test that the nvram_object is supported with the nvram_var entity matching some regular expression.

nvram_object.comment: This object represents a nvram_object with the nvram variable name equal to 'SystemAudioVolume'.
This object represents a nvram_object with the nvram variable name not equal to 'SystemAudioVolume'.
This object represents a nvram_object with the nvram variable name matching the regular expression '^SystemAudio'.

nvram_state.comment: This nvram_state represents an nvram_item which has a nvram variable name equal to 'SystemAudioVolume' and a nvram value that matches the regular expression '.*'.
This nvram_state represents nvram_items which have a nvram variable name not equal to 'SystemAudioVolume' and a nvram value that matches the regular expression '.*'.
This nvram_state represents nvram_items which have a nvram variable name that matches the regular expression '^SystemAudio' and a nvram value that matches the regular expression '.*'.
